results.title: WebSockets support in ASP.NET Core
results.description: WebSockets support in ASP.NET Core Note This isn't the latest version of this article. This article explains how to get started with WebSockets in ASP.NET Core. Http/2 WebSockets support Using WebSockets over HTTP/2 takes advantage of new features such as: Header compression. NET 7 introduced WebSockets over HTTP/2 support for Kestrel, the SignalR.

results.title: What is Azure Relay? - Azure Relay
results.description: The Azure Relay service enables you to securely expose services that run in your corpo... Hybrid Connections feature in Azure Relay is based on HTTP and WebSockets protocols. To get started with using Hybrid Connections in Azure Relay, see the following quick starts: Hybrid Connections - .NET WebSockets Hybrid Connections - Node WebSockets Hybrid.

results.title: Host and deploy ASP.NET Core server-side Blazor apps
results.description: Transports Blazor works best when using WebSockets as the SignalR transport due to lower latency, better reliability, and improved security. Azure App Service Hosting on Azure App Service requires configuration for WebSockets and session affinity, also called Application Request Routing (ARR) affinity. Enable the following for the app's.
